feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 22 at 2:19PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...RISING WATER LEVELS ON SMALL STREAMS AND CREEKS DRAINING THE BROOKS RANGE... A series of fronts will impact the region, bringing copious amounts of widespread rain that will cause water levels to rise on small streams and creeks draining the Brooks Range. Rainfall totals will range from 1.50 to 2.50 inches, with localized amounts
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lower Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 22 at 2:19PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...ELEVATED SURF LIKELY ON THURSDAY... Strong south winds to gale force will move into the West Coast and bring elevated surf to parts of Norton Sound and the Yukon Delta on Thursday. Wave action will be the greatest along south facing coastlines, with anticipated surge values of 2-4 feet above the normal high tides. The highest values will likely impact northern
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; Yukon Delta

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 1:12PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Glacier Dammed lake release causing debris to flow into Controller Bay... Satellite observations indicate that the Berg glacier dammed lake, located 65 miles east of Cordova, has likely released downstream into the Gandil River, Bering River and Bering Lake. High water from this glacier dammed lake release usually lasts for several days with large areas

entry.title: Flood Warning issued August 22 at 10:26AM MST until August 23 at 9:00AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Observed flooding changed to Major severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Arizona... Gila River at Duncan affecting Greenlee County. .Heavy rain has led to a rapid rises on the Gila River. This update includes new data as flood waters have crested at major flood stage on the Gila River at Duncan and are beginning to decrease.

entry.summary: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 800 PM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN LOUISA...GOOCHLAND AND SOUTHEASTERN FLUVANNA COUNTIES... At 732 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Kents Store to near Columbia to near Fork Union, moving southeast at 20 mph.

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued August 22 at 7:30PM EDT until August 22 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Virginia, including the following counties, Fluvanna and Louisa. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 22 at 6:50PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Louisa, northeastern Cumberland, Goochland, northwestern Caroline, northwestern Hanover, northwestern Powhatan and Fluvanna Counties through 745 PM EDT... At 649 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles west of Spotsylvania to near Ferncliff to 6 miles northeast of Centenary. Movement was southeast at 15 mph.

entry.title: Flash Flood Warning issued August 22 at 4:27PM PDT until August 22 at 6:30PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: The National Weather Service in Spokane has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Okanogan County in north central Washington... * Until 630 PM PDT. * At 427 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 22 at 4:10PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Okanogan County through 500 PM PDT... At 410 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 14 miles east of Oroville, or 41 miles northeast of Omak, moving northwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 22 at 3:55PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Okanogan County through 445 PM PDT... At 353 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 19 miles northeast of Stehekin, or 37 miles west of Omak. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail.
